page.title: 09Family life
page.content: We interviewed a{Mrs.H.T.Morton}who lives at Ballyhoy, in Milford, which is in our area. We asked her how long she had lived in this area. She said that her ancesters had settled in Milford sixty years ago in 1925 but she had only been living there for thirty years (1955). We asked her what her family and herself did for a living and for recreation. She said that she lived on a farm where they had milking cows and beef cattle. They also grow crops such as silage and grass and they also plough the land. On weekdays it is hardwork, they have to feed and milk cows and normal farmwork. On Sundays they have an easier time. In the morning they go to church and when they come home they milk the cows and then they rest.
